title: New Year's Day
summary: Artists post New-year greeting art, often characters in kimono and the year’s zodiac animal.
dateReason: First day of the calendar year; traditional Japanese Oshōgatsu celebrations.

title: Twintail Day
summary: Illustrations featuring the twin-ponytail hairstyle dominate timelines.
dateReason: 2 / 2 visually resembles two tails and is a pun on "twin" in Japanese goro-awase.

title: Bath Day
summary: Bath-scene or on-sen themed illustrations trend across JP Twitter/Pixiv.
dateReason: 2 (ふ) 6 (ろ) reads “furo” (bath) in Japanese word-play.

title: Knee-High Day
summary: Art that highlights thigh-high or knee-high socks and the 'zettai ryōiki' gap.
dateReason: 2 / 8 can be read "ni-hai," which sounds like “knee-high.”

title: Bra Day
summary: Lingerie brands spark a wave of bra-themed illustrations; tag boosted by Wacoal campaigns.
dateReason: Commemorates the first registered brassière patent in Japan (numeric mnemonic 2-12).

title: Valentine's Day
summary: Romantic or chocolate-gift art floods feeds; JP artists show girls presenting sweets.
dateReason: Global St Valentine tradition; adopted in Japan with chocolate-giving twist.

title: Cat Day
summary: Real cats, cat-girls and feline VTuber art surge; "nyan nyan nyan" pun day.
dateReason: 2-22 sounds like a triple "nyan" (meow) in Japanese.

title: Pokémon Day
summary: Franchise anniversary; official news plus massive fan-art drop online.
dateReason: Release date of Pokémon Red & Green in 1996.

title: International Women's Day
summary: Empowerment graphics, tributes to female characters and creators.
dateReason: UN-recognized day celebrating women’s achievements.

title: Miku Day
summary: Hatsune Miku fan-art, music releases and streams dominate feeds.
dateReason: 3 (み) 9 (く) → "Miku" pun.

title: Mario Day
summary: Mario franchise art, memes and Nintendo promotions.
dateReason: “MAR10” looks like the word “Mario.”

title: White Day
summary: Return-gift illustrations (usually male characters giving sweets).
dateReason: Exactly one month after Valentine’s Day; confectioners created the custom.

title: Sakura Day
summary: Timelines bloom with cherry-blossom landscapes and characters under sakura.
dateReason: 3×9 (= 27) ties to "sakura" word-play and seasonal blossom.

title: Good Bath Day
summary: Cosy bath/onsen art—often steamy pin-ups—trends on the tag.
dateReason: 4-2-6 reads “yo-i-fu-ro” → ‘good bath’.

title: Easter Bunny Girl
rules: Date follows Easter Sunday each year; next early-year slot is 5 Apr 2026 (20 Apr 2025).
summary: Artists draw bunny-suit characters to match Easter bunny lore.
dateReason: Easter = first Sunday after the Paschal full moon; date moves within March–April.

title: Golden (Bikini) Week
rules: Runs every year for the whole Golden Week holiday (29 Apr – 5 May).
summary: Shiny gold-swimsuit fan-art parallels Japan’s “Golden Week” holiday.
dateReason: "Golden" week inspires the gold-bikini gimmick during the long spring break.

title: Green Tea Day
rules: Falls on the 88th night after Risshun; 2026 date (non-leap) is 2 May.
summary: Tea-themed art—fresh shincha leaves, teacups—fills feeds.
dateReason: The 88th night is considered the ideal tea-picking day in Japanese agriculture.

title: Star Wars Day
summary: Lightsaber battles, Jedi/Sith VTubers and fan-art dominate timelines.
dateReason: Pun on the saga catch-phrase “May the fourth be with you.”

title: Maid Day
summary: Cosplayers and illustrators serve maid-outfit shots all day.
dateReason: 'May-do' sounds like "maid" in Japanese pronunciation.

title: Cream Puff Day
rules: Technically the 19th of every month; many artists highlight the spring 19 May slot.
summary: Dessert-themed art—especially fluffy choux pastries—trends.
dateReason: Created by confectioner Monteur; 19 (iku) chosen as mnemonic.

title: Kimono Day
summary: Feeds fill with elegant kimono fashion art and photo shoots.
dateReason: 5-2-9 pun "go-fu-ku"—an old word for kimono fabric.

title: Yuri Day
summary: Girls’ Love pairings and romantic GL fan-art bloom online.
dateReason: June 25’s birth-flower is the lily (yuri).

title: Bikini Day
summary: Swimsuit and beach-scene illustrations mark summer’s start.
dateReason: Anniversary of the bikini’s debut in 1946.

title: Tanabata
summary: Yukata-clad characters writing wishes, Milky-Way backdrops.
dateReason: Traditional Star Festival date of Vega & Altair meeting.

title: Oppai Day
summary: Breast-focused fan-art; often playful or lewd.
dateReason: 8-1 pun interpreted as 'oppai' (breasts).

title: Yaoi Day
summary: Boy's love/yaoi creators share art and recs.
dateReason: Numeric 801 → 'ya-o-i'.

title: Miku Birthday
summary: Birthday festival for Hatsune Miku—new songs and artwork everywhere.
dateReason: Date the original vocaloid software released in 2007.

title: Glasses Day
summary: Moe 'megane' characters and eyeglass selfies flood the timeline.
dateReason: 1001 looks like eyeglasses (0= lenses, 1= temples).

title: No Bra Day
summary: Braless character art + breast-cancer awareness posts.
dateReason: Part of Breast-Cancer Awareness Month initiatives.

title: Halloween
summary: Costumes, horror-themed art and VTuber outfit reveals.
dateReason: Traditional Western holiday, now global pop-culture mainstay.

title: Dog Day
summary: Dog photos, canine kemonomimi and pup-themed illustrations.
dateReason: 1-1-1 read as 'wan-wan-wan' (dog bark) in Japanese.

title: Good Ass Day
summary: Illustrations celebrating shapely backsides trend all day.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 04 word-play for 'good butt' in Japanese.

title: Nice Tummy Day
summary: Flat abs, soft bellies—artists showcase midriff art.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 07 pun “いいおなか” (nice stomach).

title: Nice Boobs Day
summary: Bust appreciation art—both playful and lewd—takes over feeds.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 08 creative reading of 'oppai' for 'nice boobs'.

title: Good Armpit Day
summary: Armpit-focused illustrations circulate under niche tag.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 09 pun 'いい脇' (good armpit).

title: Pocky Day
summary: Characters share Pocky sticks; companies run tie-in art comps.
dateReason: 11-11 resembles four Pocky biscuit sticks.

title: Nice Thigh Day
summary: Thigh-centric pin-ups appear; absolute-territory fans rejoice.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 20 pun for 'futomomo' (thigh).

title: Good Twintail Day
summary: A second yearly boost for twintail-hair illustrations.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 22 pun 'nice twintails'.

title: Nice Knee-High Day
summary: More zettai-ryōiki goodness — knee-high socks everywhere.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 28 pun 'nice knee-high'.

title: Nice Butt Day
summary: Back-view, hip-focused art trends again at month-end.
dateReason: 11 (ii) + 30 as the 'end' of the month—cheeky word-play.

title: Christmas
summary: Santa outfits, snowy scenes and festive VTuber streams close the year.
dateReason: Traditional Christian holiday that became global pop culture.
